result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Robert Mattson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation no later than 4:30 pm on September 23, 2014.

miscConds.notes: May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
No voting until civil rights are restored. No holding of public office. If not a U.S. Citizen might face deportation. No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Must give a DNA sample but no surcharge. Follow through with COMPAS Evaluation and recommendations. Must maintain employment. Must write an apology letter to Dawn Hunter.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Robert Mattson
